org.openimaj.image.analysis.pyramid

Class SimplePyramid<IMAGE extends Image<?,IMAGE> & SinglebandImageProcessor.Processable<Float,FImage,IMAGE>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.image.analysis.pyramid.SimplePyramid<IMAGE>
  • Type Parameters:
    IMAGE - the underlying image type
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<IMAGE>, ImageAnalyser<IMAGE>, ImageProcessor<IMAGE>, Processor<IMAGE>

    public class SimplePyramid<IMAGE extends Image<?,IMAGE> & SinglebandImageProcessor.Processable<Float,FImage,IMAGE>>
extends Object
implements ImageAnalyser<IMAGE>, ImageProcessor<IMAGE>, Iterable<IMAGE>
    A simple image pyramid built as a stack of images. For convenience, when applied to an image as an ImageProcessor, the last level of the pyramid will be assigned to the input image. SimplePyramids also allow you to specify a processor that is applied between levels. For example, a Gaussian blur could be applied to make a Gaussian pyramid. SimplePyramids are @link{Iterable}, so you can iterate over the levels.
    Author:
    Sina Samangooei (ss@ecs.soton.ac.uk), Jonathon Hare (jsh2@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimplePyramid

        public SimplePyramid(float power)
        Construct a pyramid with the given scale factor. The number of levels is such that the lowest level of the pyramid is a minimum of 8 pixels on its shortest side.
        Parameters:
        power - scale factor between levels

      • SimplePyramid

        public SimplePyramid(float power,
                     int nlevels)
        Construct a pyramid with the given scale factor and number of levels. If the number of levels is zero or less, then the actual number of levels will be calculated dynamically so the shortest side of the bottom level has at least 8 pixels.
        Parameters:
        power - scale factor between levels
        nlevels - number of levels

      • SimplePyramid

        public SimplePyramid(float power,
                     Processor<IMAGE> processor)
        Construct a pyramid with the given scale factor. The number of levels is such that the lowest level of the pyramid is a minimum of 8 pixels on its shortest side. The processor will be applied before subsampling occurs.
        Parameters:
        power - scale factor between levels
        processor - a processor to apply before subsampling

      • SimplePyramid

        public SimplePyramid(float power,
                     int nlevels,
                     Processor<IMAGE> processor)
        Construct a pyramid with the given scale factor and number of levels. If the number of levels is zero or less, then the actual number of levels will be calculated dynamically so the shortest side of the bottom level has at least 8 pixels. The processor will be applied before subsampling occurs.
        Parameters:
        power - scale factor between levels
        nlevels - number of levels
        processor - a processor to apply before subsampling

        public static <T extends Image<?,T> & SinglebandImageProcessor.Processable<Float,FImage,T>> SimplePyramid<T> createGaussianPyramid(T image,
                                                                                                                                   float sigma,
                                                                                                                                   int nLevels)
        Convenience method to create a gaussian pyramid from an image. There is a fixed number of levels with powers of two between levels.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of image
        Parameters:
        image - the image
        sigma - the amount of blurring
        nLevels - the number of levels
        Returns:
